entry.title: Calling BrowserView::Show() > 1 times result in a dangling ptr in unit unit test.
entry.content:
Calling `BrowserView::Show()` more than once results in some wayland object on `WaylandSurface` not properly released.
This is probably due to wayland not supporting client side initiated activate apart from the first activate which creates the window.
Thus probably some wayland object is left hanging around waiting for a configure to come back (which never does).
``` #0 0x5570d15d61f2 base::debug::CollectStackTrace() #1 0x5570d15beb83 base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace() #2 0x5570d15db555 base::allocator::(anonymous namespace)::DanglingRawPtrDetected() #3 0x5570d189ef59 allocator_shim::internal::PartitionFree() #4 0x5570d32524b5 wl_proxy_destroy_caller_locks #5 0x5570d325284a wl_proxy_marshal_array_flags #6 0x5570d32529f2 wl_proxy_marshal_flags #7 0x5570cb75f27b ui::WaylandSurface::~WaylandSurface() #8 0x5570cb76bc4f ui::WaylandWindow::~WaylandWindow() #9 0x5570cb765df8 ui::WaylandToplevelWindow::~WaylandToplevelWindow() #10 0x5570cb765f7e ui::WaylandToplevelWindow::~WaylandToplevelWindow() #11 0x5570d180a51d views::DesktopWindowTreeHostPlatform::OnClosed() #12 0x5570cb76dbd2 ui::WaylandWindow::Close() #13 0x5570d1807d0a views::DesktopWindowTreeHostPlatform::CloseNow() #14 0x5570d17f6a50 views::DesktopNativeWidgetAura::CloseNow() #15 0x5570d179d6ce views::Widget::CloseNow() #16 0x5570d056a25d TestWithBrowserView::TearDown() #17 0x5570cae19468 testing::TestInfo::Run() #18 0x5570cae19f17 testing::TestSuite::Run() #19 0x5570cae28777 testing::internal::UnitTestImpl::RunAllTests() #20 0x5570cae280a3 testing::UnitTest::Run() #21 0x5570d0589f48 base::TestSuite::Run() #22 0x5570d099c156 content::UnitTestTestSuite::Run() #23 0x5570c72b0d90 base::OnceCallback<>::Run() #24 0x5570d058f44b base::(anonymous namespace)::LaunchUnitTestsInternal() #25 0x5570d058f239 base::LaunchUnitTests() #26 0x5570d056e4ba main #27 0x7f4fe582e6ca (/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6+0x276c9) #28 0x7f4fe582e785 __libc_start_main #29 0x5570c72a802a _start ```

entry.title: Element.scrollTop truncation causes a 1px discrepancy in specific zoom levels.
entry.content:
The provided element_scrollTop_rounding_issue.html examines an issue related to the truncation of `Element.scrollTop`
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Download the attached element_scrollTop_rounding_issue.html and load 2. Upon loading the page, observe the initial value of scrollTop, displayed as "Zoom: 100%, ScrollTop: 77". 3. Adjust the zoom level to 120% by entering "120" in the "Enter Zoom Value (70, 85, 100, 125, 150):" input field and clicking the "Apply Zoom Level" button. 4. Reset the zoom level back to 100% by clicking the "Reset to 100% Zoom Level" button.
What is the expected result? After resetting to 100% zoom level, the displayed value should read "Zoom: 100%, ScrollTop: 77".
What happens instead of that? Instead, a discrepancy of 1 pixel is observed, displaying "Zoom: 100%, ScrollTop: 76".
This discrepancy occurs due to truncation when the scrollTop value is saved, particularly when FractionalScrollOffsetsEnabled is disabled.
``` void ScrollableArea::ScrollOffsetChanged(const ScrollOffset& offset, mojom::blink::ScrollType scroll_type) { TRACE_EVENT2("input", "ScrollableArea::scrollOffsetChanged", "x", offset.x(), "y", offset.y()); TRACE_EVENT_INSTANT1("input", "Type", TRACE_EVENT_SCOPE_THREAD, "type", scroll_type);
ScrollOffset old_offset = GetScrollOffset(); ScrollOffset truncated_offset = ShouldUseIntegerScrollOffset() ? ScrollOffset(gfx::ToFlooredVector2d(offset)) : offset; ```

entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open a page and create a broadcast channel 2. Open an iframe with the same origin as the page in step 1 and create a broadcast channel for the same channel as the page 3. Send a message in the main page to broadcast channel 4. Send a message from the iframe to broadcast channel
# Problem Description We were expecting to see the message from main window to reach the iframe in the same origin and vice-versa but the messages are never received
# Summary Broadcast channel not working between main window and iframe in same origin

#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know

entry.title: Developer Tools Search doesn't return results after running a Performance trace
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem It WORKS in this case 1. Go to this web page https://www.lampade.it/p/lindby-livel-pannello-led-4-000k-80-cm-x-30-cm-9956002.html 2. Open dev tools 3. Open the Search tab 4. Search for the function name "onStageTap" 5. Results are returned
It DOESN'T work in this case 1. Go to this web page https://www.lampade.it/p/lindby-livel-pannello-led-4-000k-80-cm-x-30-cm-9956002.html 2. Open dev tools 3. Start recording with performance tab 4. Stop recording 5. Open the Search tab 6. Search for the function name "onStageTap" 7. No results are returned
It WORKS AGAIN in this case 1. Reload the page with CMD+R, without clicking anywhere else in dev tools 2. Search for the function name "onStageTap" 3. Results are returned
# Problem Description It looks like the Search tab in Developer Tools doesn't return results after running a Performance trace
# Additional Comments I've checked many times, the outcome is consistent. Also checked Canary 123.0.6312.0, same issue there.
# Summary Developer Tools Search doesn't return results after running a Performance trace
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug - Software not working correctly
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: [Input Vizard] Investigate whether RenderInputRouter's mojo connections need to be setup on CrRendererMain or RendererCompositor thread.
entry.content:
Currently(in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5185080), we are setting up RenderInputRouter mojo connections on CrRendererMain thread(see [here](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5185080/17/third_party/blink/renderer/platform/widget/widget_base.cc#562)). However, we might want to setup these connections on RendererCompositorThread to reduce the problems arising due to contention on main thread(including contention with Javascript during method calls). However, this would also depend on the methods we end up adding to RenderInputRouterClient and RenderInputRouterHost interfaces, which haven't been fully-fleshed out right now.
This bug will keep track of the updates to these mojo interfaces and depending on the requirements, we can move the setup to RendererCompositor Thread in future, which will also help by avoiding contention with javascript during method calls on CrRendererMain.

entry.title: url_pattern_fuzzer and v8_serialized_script_value_fuzzer don't get coverage
entry.content:
We gather some coverage information for every single libfuzzer fuzzer except these two.
We try to invoke `url_pattern_fuzzer` against 1000 test cases but they all result in a deadly signal (as described in issue 326191688) and an immediate crash without recording any coverage information.
The same applies to `v8_serialized_script_value_fuzzer`.

entry.title: Coverage dashboard reports mysterious deadly signal
entry.content:
A typical run of our fuzzing coverage dashboard reports fuzzers crashing for various reasons. (Here's some [recent output](https://logs.chromium.org/logs/chromium/buildbucket/cr-buildbucket/8755604790862243953/+/u/process_fuzz_coverage/run_all_fuzzers/stdout), though this may have timed out by the time you read this link - you can find more linked from the "previous runs" section of go/chrome-fuzzing-dashboard)
If it's a `CHECK` failure we seem to get good output:
``` WARNING: Failed to find function "__sanitizer_acquire_crash_state". WARNING: Failed to find function "__sanitizer_print_stack_trace". WARNING: Failed to find function "__sanitizer_set_death_callback". INFO: found LLVMFuzzerCustomMutator (0x55daf318efc0). Disabling -len_control by default. INFO: Running with entropic power schedule (0xFF, 100). INFO: Seed: 1107509173 INFO: 3235 files found in current-corpora-from-clusterfuzz/video_capture_host_mojolpm_fuzzer INFO: -max_len is not provided; libFuzzer will not generate inputs larger than 1048576 bytes INFO: seed corpus: files: 3235 min: 1b max: 4814324b total: 39986871b rss: 83Mb [0219/222407.722820:FATAL:render_process_host_impl.cc(4287)] Check failed: BrowserThread::CurrentlyOn(BrowserThread::UI) || !BrowserThread::IsThreadInitialized(BrowserThread::UI). #0 0x55db0b6218f7 base::debug::CollectStackTrace() #1 0x55db0b5dc8c5 base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace() #2 0x55db0b5dc860 base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace() #3 0x55db0b23f000 logging::LogMessage::Flush() #4 0x55db0b23ee62 logging::LogMessage::~LogMessage() #5 0x55db0b1f4730 logging::(anonymous namespace)::DCheckLogMessage::~DCheckLogMessage() #6 0x55db0b1f4759 logging::(anonymous namespace)::DCheckLogMessage::~DCheckLogMessage() #7 0x55db0b1f3d20 logging::CheckError::~CheckError() #8 0x55dafcb0d089 content::RenderProcessHostImpl::RegisterCreationObserver() #9 0x55dafcaf460e content::RenderProcessHostCreationObserver::RenderProcessHostCreationObserver() #10 0x55dafbfaa0b1 content::MediaInternals::MediaInternals() ```
etc.
but the majority of fuzzers just crash with `deadly signal`:
``` WARNING: Failed to find function "__sanitizer_acquire_crash_state". WARNING: Failed to find function "__sanitizer_print_stack_trace". This WARNING: Failed to find function "__sanitizer_set_death_callback". INFO: found LLVMFuzzerCustomMutator (0x5636d8867010). Disabling -len_control by default. INFO: Running with entropic power schedule (0xFF, 100). INFO: Seed: 1122155311 out/Release/webcodecs_image_decoder_fuzzer: Running 1 inputs 1 time(s) each. Running: current-corpora-from-clusterfuzz/webcodecs_image_decoder_fuzzer/81a02282118689226504e87a1c3d53dd6eb56c52\nExecuted current-corpora-from-clusterfuzz/webcodecs_image_decoder_fuzzer/81a02282118689226504e87a1c3d53dd6eb56c52 in 756 ms *** *** NOTE: fuzzing was not performed, you have only *** executed the target code on a fixed set of inputs. *** ==1391100== ERROR: libFuzzer: deadly signal NOTE: libFuzzer has rudimentary signal handlers. Combine libFuzzer with AddressSanitizer or similar for better crash reports. SUMMARY: libFuzzer: deadly signal' ```
We need to figure out what this deadly signal is.

entry.title: mojolpm fuzzers not really reflected in coverage dashboard
entry.content:
Looking at the [fuzzing coverage dashboard view of our mojolpm fuzzers](https://analysis.chromium.org/coverage/p/chromium/dir?host=chromium.googlesource.com&project=chromium/src&ref=refs/heads/main&revision=f8f2853c8dae2839054331e47db7639461e963e3&path=//content/test/fuzzer/&platform=fuzz&test_suite_type=any), we see that only `code_cache_host_mojolpm_fuzzer` has reasonable coverage.
This appears to be because of the logic in [`run_all_fuzzers.py`](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:tools/code_coverage/run_all_fuzzers.py;l=53?q=run_all_fu) which does this: * Attempts to run the fuzzer against the whole corpus * If that fails, run against individual samples until we accumulate 10 or more valid coverage samples
In the case of `code_cache_host_mojolpm_fuzzer`, the first step succeeds, so we get the net coverage information from 1100 samples, of which 954 have valid content. (Possibly more. 1100 have valid protobufs).
But for `clipboard_host_mojolpm_fuzzer`, some test case causes us to hit a failure which `libFuzzer` reports as a `deadly signal`. (I don't know what this is.) We then try to run the individual test cases. We gather coverage for 10 of them, but as far as I can see: * 8 of them aren't even valid protobuf * 2 of them have empty protobufs so we don't actually get to running any production code taking any actions.
Perhaps the numbers here can be tweaked a little.

entry.title: Please give Dart EngProd access to logs in chromecompute project
entry.content:
The startup logs for Windows VMs in Dart's LUCI swarming pool, in the dart-internal GCP project, are being sent to the chromecompute project, according to information from a chat.
We would like the dart-engprod group to be given log read access to the chromecompute project so we can see the startup logs.

entry.title: Unfuzzed field trial: WebRTC-LibvpxVp9Encoder-SvcFrameDropConfig
entry.content: Our [fuzzing coverage report](https://analysis.chromium.org/coverage/p/chromium/file?host=chromium.googlesource.com&project=chromium/src&ref=refs/heads/main&revision=f8f2853c8dae2839054331e47db7639461e963e3&path=//third_party/webrtc/test/fuzzers/vp9_encoder_references_fuzzer.cc&platform=fuzz&test_suite_type=any&modifier_id=0) is showing little coverage for `vp9_encoder_references_fuzzer` because it seems to [crash](https://logs.chromium.org/logs/chromium/buildbucket/cr-buildbucket/8755604790862243953/+/u/process_fuzz_coverage/run_all_fuzzers/stdout) with `Unfuzzed field trial WebRTC-LibvpxVp9Encoder-SvcFrameDropConfig`. I'm not sure what this fuzzer is all about or whether this is intentional but thought I'd pass it on.

entry.title: MAUI app opens Chrome browser outside application on Chromebook, but works on Android Applicaion - How to fix?
Adopt single BookmarkModel instance on iOS
entry.content:
Under ios/, there are two instances of BookmarkModel, with one factory each.
On other platforms, it was decided together with sky@ that a single BookmarkModel should be used, and that this design should be the long-term solution on all platforms, including iOS.
This bug is about migrating iOS to using a single BookmarkModel instance.

entry.title: Dark theme is disabled automatically after changing language in Lighthouse report

Chrome Version: 123.0.6312.2 (Official Build) canary (arm64) ee77acc178bb8175e0f0b1967d1bd0bbcc9d5a82-refs/branch-heads/6312@{#6}
OS : Mac,Win(10,11),Linux

After generating report, click on 3 dots>Click on Open in Viewer 5. Click on 3 dots and select Toggle Dark Theme 6. Now click on language icon and choose any language 7. Observe that, the theme is changed to light automatically
Actual Result: Dark theme is disabled automatically after changing language in Lighthouse report

Please refer to the screencast below: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YPchv4UtFPhY1Z5bPS3yIQjmagzRKN-u/view?usp=drive_link

Thanks..!!

entry.title: [css-anchor-position] Percentage fallbacks prevent simplification
entry.content: For example, top:min(anchor(--a top, 10%), 20%) results in the computed value "top:min(10%, 20%)" when serialized. This is incorrect, the computed value should just be "top:10%".

entry.title: Rework WPT tests for garbage collection ports
entry.content:
The following tests for message channels are broken the way they are written: - wpt/webmessaging/message-channels/close-event/garbage-collected.tentative.any.worker.html - wpt/webmessaging/message-channels/close-event/garbage-collected.tentative.any.html
The tests are not working in any browser [1] as of today.
The test is written to just call `gc()`. This GC will be synchronous and as such fails to reclaim interesting memory. For `content_shell` we forced stackless GCs after invoking tasks for testing purposes only. As of today, these two tests here are the only ones that need this mode to pass. For `chrome` the tests never pass and are also flagged as such [2].
The mode for the stackless GC here is bypassing the scheduler (doesn't post a task) and does not support nested runloops. This was discovered in b/325123755. As part of fixing that bug we will remove this testing-only mode.
For non-WPT tests we have `asyncGC()` and `await gc({type:'major', execution:'async'})` to write such tests.
We could delete those upstream and re-work the tests just for Chrome.
Alternatively, we would need a way to run truly async GCs through WPT and rework the tests there.
[1]: https://wpt.fyi/results/webmessaging/message-channels/close-event?label=experimental&label=master&aligned [2]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/web_tests/ChromeTestExpectations;l=591?q=ChromeTestExpectations&ss=chromium

entry.title: SceneState should implement BrowserProviderInterface
Use dynamic cursor size on Intel GPUs
entry.content:
Intel GPUs have a seperate hardware cursor plane, which supports buffers with width of {64, 128, 256} [1]. My local experiments show that using smaller cursor sizes can reduce power consumption for some scenarios. As Chromium is currently always using the default max 256x256, I create this issue to explore if we can use dynamic cursor buffer size based on the input bitmap.
CL: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5271574
On an ADL chromebook, by using 64x64 cursor size: 1) Video playback shows ~230mW (~13%) package power gain. (Window mode, keep the cursor visible, test page: https://jiahe93.github.io/single_video_test/SingleVideo.html) 2) Google Meet 1:1 call shows 36mW (0.8%) package power gain.
[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v6.1/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/display/intel_cursor.c;l=367

entry.title: DCHECK: MediaStreamVideoTrackUnderlyingSource::OnFrameFromTrack
entry.content:
Chrome Version: f8e1bd707b4cf6ebe5718d28498ac02769afd2a3 OS: Mac, but probably platform-agnostic
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Launch Meet, crash in greenroom
It seems Chrome has lost support for `UseThreadPoolForMediaStreamVideoTaskRunner,UseThreadPoolForMediaTaskRunner`
``` [60198:12035:0220/213822.709341:FATAL:media_stream_video_track_underlying_source.cc(93)] Check failed: GetIOTaskRunner()->RunsTasksInCurrentSequence(). 0 Chromium Framework 0x0000000125418ef4 entry.title: Initiator popup is displayed incorrectly in network panel
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Go to - https://example.org/ 2. Open devtools 3. Go to "Console" tab and run: fetch('/') 4. Go to "Network" tab 5. Hover mouse on initiator
# Problem Description The initiator popup is displayed incorrectly.
# Additional Comments The same issue occurs in Chrome dev 123.0.6300.3
# Summary Initiator popup is displayed incorrectly in network panel
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: startUpChromeUI should use the browser state associated to the scene
Update scheduleTasksRequiringBVCWithBrowserState for multiple browser states
Remove use of appState.mainBrowserState from AppMetricsAppStateAgent
[Non-Regression]:while trying to zoom in and zoom out the sent gif in chats observed unnecessary white lines
entry.content:
Chrome Version: M123 Dev #123.0.6276.0/15770.0.0 on Tomato(cherry) device LaCrOS Version : LaCrOS Beta RC #123.0.6312.4[LaCrOS-Only] OS: Chrome
Details: ----------------------------------------------------- 1)Accounts: Test account and corp account 2)Enterprise Enrolled: yes 3)Devices: Non-corp device Tomato(cherry) -Lacros 64/arm 64 4)Repro on Ash-chrome: yes- M123 Dev 123.0.6276.0/15770.0.0 on Tomato(cherry) device 5)Mode: Normal mode 6)Frequency: Always
Enabled the lacros flags #lacros-stability = Beta #lacros-only = Enabled #enable-component-updater-test-request = Enabled
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Launch Lacros 2.Open NTP and naviagte to Google chats 3.Try tosend any gif in the chat ,now try to zoom in & zoom out and observe
What is the expected result? No issues should be seen when zoom in and zoom out the Gif
What happens instead? Instead Observed some white lines when trying to zoom in and zoom out
Note: 1) Issue is also seen in ash-chrome 2)Issue seems to be in-consistent(3 out of 5 times)
This issue is not seen on M111 Stable #111.0.5563.152/15329.63.0 on Lava(Coral) device
Attaching feedback report :https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91576542869

entry.title: Settings: hovering over any cr-expand-button in Chrome Settings shows an "undefined" overlay
entry.content:
Chrome Version: Linux, TOT, 124.0.6314.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit) OS: Desktop
How to reproduce: 1. Navigate to any of the Chrome settings pages listed below. 2. Hover over the corresponding cr-expand-button, which is either the whole row, or just the expand button carret at the end of the row.
What should happen? - No "undefined" overlay should be shown.
What happens instead? - An overlay is shows with the text "undefined"
This seems to affect all cr-expand-button elements across Chrome settings, including:
- Page: chrome://settings/adPrivacy/sites; cr-expand-button: "Sites you blocked" - Page: chrome://settings/adPrivacy/interests; cr-expand-button: "Topics you blocked" - Page: chrome://settings/content; cr-expand-buttons: "Additional content settings" and "Additional permissions" - Page: chrome://settings/performance; cr-expand-buttons: "Extended preloading" and "Standard preloading" - Page: chrome://settings/security; cr-expand-buttons: "Enhanced protection" and "Standard protection" - Page: chrome://settings/syncSetup; cr-expand-button: "Encryption options"

Issue filed automatically.
To reproduce this, please build the target in this report and run it against the reproducer testcase. Please use the GN arguments provided at bottom of this report when building the binary.
If you have trouble reproducing, please also export the environment variables listed under "[Environment]" in the crash stacktrace.
If you have any feedback on reproducing test cases, let us know at https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5 so we can improve.
************************* UNREPRODUCIBLE ************************* Note: This crash might not be reproducible with the provided testcase. That said, for the past 14 days, we've been seeing this crash frequently.
It may be possible to reproduce by trying the following options: - Run testcase multiple times for a longer duration. - Run fuzzing without testcase argument to hit the same crash signature.
If it still does not reproduce, try a speculative fix based on the crash stacktrace and verify if it works by looking at the crash statistics in the report. We will auto-close the bug if the crash is not seen for 14 days. ******************************************************************

entry.title: Slow performance `Intl.Segmenter` when segmenting texts (e.g. words or grahemes)
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem Call `Intl.Segmenter([], {granularity: 'grapheme' /* or 'word' */ })` and iterate over it
# Problem Description When recording a perf profile with D8 of a dart2wasm-compiled program that uses the `Intl.Segmenter` API to segment a ~20 character ascii string, I got the following profile (see https://pprofng.corp.google.com/?id=299a65ab9c5259f240b1e84a722e1401)
On a high-end P920 desktop it seemingly takes around 1 us per ascii byte. On low end phones probably at least 10+x slower.
The bottom up profile shows: ``` Self % Function 628,524,058 5.571%v8::internal::JSObject::MigrateToMap 589,125,723 5.222%JS:wasm-to-js--none 474,708,620 4.208%v8::internal::JSReceiver::CreateDataProperty 437,247,775 3.876%v8::internal::(anonymous namespace)::UpdateDescriptorForValue (map.cc) 421,802,247 3.739%v8::internal::Map::TransitionToDataProperty 325,312,672 2.883%v8::internal::LookupIterator::PrepareTransitionToDataProperty 305,763,461 2.710%__libc_malloc (malloc.c) 299,846,784 2.658%icu_73::RuleBasedBreakIterator::handleNext (rbbi.cpp) 299,239,115 2.652%v8::internal::LookupIterator::ApplyTransitionToDataProperty 276,802,010 2.453%v8::internal::Object::AddDataProperty 276,469,980 2.451%v8::internal::Object::TransitionAndWriteDataProperty 242,056,444 2.146%_int_free (malloc.c) 237,420,691 2.104%v8::internal::JSObject::DefineOwnPropertyIgnoreAttributes 234,431,484 2.078%v8::internal::TransitionsAccessor::SearchTransition 207,820,536 1.842%_int_malloc (malloc.c) 187,156,354 1.659%v8::internal::LookupIterator::LookupInRegularHolder 183,770,397 1.629%JS:*_176 /usr/local/google/home/kustermann/sdk4/intl_segmenter_bench.mjs:121:7 176,130,422 1.561%v8::internal::JSSegmentIterator::Next 169,428,138 1.502%v8::internal::LookupIterator::Start 163,086,393 1.446%v8::internal::LookupIterator::LookupIterator 161,495,661 1.431%v8::internal::JSSegments::CreateSegmentDataObject 149,520,090 1.325%v8::internal::JSObject::WriteToField 148,051,094 1.312%v8::internal::Factory::AllocateRawWithAllocationSite 147,997,553 1.312%malloc_consolidate (malloc.c) ```
It doesn't seem very efficiently implemented, as one would assume it's simply looking at the next unicode character and make a JS object with 3 values in it.
# Additional Comments See profile: https://pprofng.corp.google.com/?id=299a65ab9c5259f240b1e84a722e1401
# Summary Slow performance `Intl.Segmenter` when segmenting texts (e.g. words or grahemes)
# Additional Data Category: JavaScript \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Incognito window browsing choose http/2 instead of http/3 when redirecting 301 from http to https
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem setup: 1. In chrome://settings/security advanced, turn on Always use secure connections 2. Use Incognito window to view the result, as normal window might cache the 301 redirection. enter http://puti.org/ in the browser location.
browse: 1. browser connect to http://puti.org/ uses http/1.1, get 301 redirect to https://puti.org/ 2. browser connects https://puti.org/ using http/2, get 302 redirect to https://www.puti.org/ (note, without turning on always use secure connections, this will use http/3, and works just fine) 3. browser connects to https://www.puti.org/ using http/2, get 302 redirect to https://www.puti.org/ch/ , now browser blocks it, and says it's unsafe.
# Problem Description The puti.org site is Cloudflare based and turned http/3. so it always returns Alt-Svc: h3=":443"; ma=86400 in the response header. If in browse step 2, using http3, then there won't be a problem.
Either there is a problem with chrome, should not block https://www.puti.org/ch/ in http/2 (browse step 3), or it should try to use http/3 after get redirected from http to https, just like without turning on "always use secure connections" (browse step 2).
# Summary Incognito window browsing choose http/2 instead of http/3 when redirecting 301 from http to https
# Additional Data Category: Network / Downloading \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A
